briefTitle: Phase III Trial BI 695502 Plus Chemotherapy vs. Avastin® Plus Chemotherapy in Patients With Lung Cancer
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind Phase III Trial to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of BI 695502 Plus Chemotherapy Versus Avastin® Plus Chemotherapy in Patients With Advanced Nonsquamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
summary: The objective of this phase III trial is to establish statistical equivalence in terms of efficacy (best overall response rate \[ORR\], proportion of patients with complete response \[CR\] plus partial response \[PR\]) until 18 weeks of first-line treatment with BI 695502 plus chemotherapy versus Avastin® plus chemotherapy followed by maintenance monotherapy with either BI 695502 or Avastin®.

primaryOutcome.measure: Best Overall Response Rate (ORR), Based on Unconfirmed Response Assessment, as Assessed by Central Imaging Review Until 18 Weeks After the Start of Treatment
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Tumor assessment scans were performed at baseline, Cycle 3 (Week 6), Cycle 5 (Week 12) and at Week 18 ±14 days. Best ORR evaluated until confirmed disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, death or up to 18 weeks, whichever happened earlier.
